item.title: Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora ‘Third-Person Update’ launches December 5
item.content:encoded:
• Luna
  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Due out alongside "New Game+" mode.

Publisher Ubisoft and developer Massive Entertainment will release a free update for Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora on December 5 that adds an option third-person perspective mode, as well as a “New Game+” mode, the companies announced.

“We’ve always envisioned Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora as a living world that evolves with our players,” said Massive Entertainment creative director Omar Bouali. “This update is a celebration of our community’s passion and we’re thankful to our players for their support. It means the world to our team.”

Here are the details:

In Third-Person Mode, players can experience Pandora from a new perspective at the push of a button. Whether exploring the Western Frontier, fighting the RDA, or simply taking in the views, Third-Person Mode brings a new sense of scale, freedom, and immersion. The development team has reworked animations, controls, audio, and camera systems to ensure the experience feels seamless and intuitive.

New Game+ offers a fresh challenge for seasoned players looking to dive deeper into the world of Pandora. Players can replay the story of Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora while keeping their inventory and skills, facing tougher enemies and unlocking a brand-new skill tree and more powerful gear.

This new update follows Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora‘s post-launch content, including two story packs (which are unavailable in New Game+):

  • “The Sky Breaker,” where players join the great Na’vi games and witness the Zakru migration.
  • “Secrets of the Spires, “introducing a stunning mountainous region designed to elevate the thrill of banshee flight.

Since launch, there have also been quality-of-life updates, including a revamped Hunter’s Guide, smoother 40 frames per second mode, and rebalanced combat.

Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PC via Ubisoft Store, and Luna.

item.title: Atari 50: The Anniversary Celebration DLC ‘The Namco Legendary Pack’ announced
item.content:encoded:
Publisher Atari and developer Digital Eclipse have announced Atari 50: The Anniversary Celebration downloadable content “The Namco Legendary Pack.” It will launch in 2025 for $7.99.

Here is an overview of the downloadable content, via Atari:

This expansion tells the story of the early partnership between the two companies and will be available later this year for $7.99 USD. The Namco Connection will feature the best-selling PAC-MAN for Atari 2600, along with a collection of titles from the Atari 2600, Atari 5200 and Atari 7800, including GALAGA, DIG DUG, XEVIOUS, and GALAXIAN. Players can jump straight into any game or explore the collection chronologically through an interactive timeline featuring developer interviews, archival documents, photos from the era and more.

Atari 50: The Anniversary Celebration is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, PC via Steam and GOG, and Atari VCS.

item.title: BUILD ORDER – BitSummit the 13th trailer
item.content:encoded:
New look at the latest game from the studio behind MALICIOUS.

MALICIOUS developer ALVION has released a new trailer for BUILD ORDER as part of BitSummit the 13th, which ran from July 18 to 20 at Miyako Messe in Kyoto, Japan. A teaser website was also launched.

BUILD ORDER, which was first announced at BitSummit in 2024, is a strategic action game that combines combat and base building. Players will fight hordes of enemies with “Star Spirits,” build a base, and dominate the battlefield. With multiplayer support, players will also be able to fight alongside friends, form strategies, and face against enemy forces together.

Platforms and a release date for BUILD ORDER have yet to be announced.
